ai-dn5:18.4_0: They did the work they wanted to, and did not do what they didn’t want to.
ai-dn5:18.5_0: The sacrifice was completed with just ghee, oil, butter, curds, honey, and molasses.
ai-dn5:19.1_0: Then the aristocrat vassals of town and country went to the well-to-do aristocrats, brahmins and householders and householders, with lots of town and country, and say:
ai-dn5:19.2_0: ‘Sire, this abundant wealth is specially for you alone; may Your Highness accept it!’
ai-dn5:19.3_0: ‘There’s enough raised for me through regular taxes. Let this be for you; and here, take even more!’
ai-dn5:19.5_0: When the king turned them down, they withdrew to one side to think up a plan,
ai-dn5:19.6_0: ‘It wouldn’t be proper for us to take this abundant wealth back to our own homes.
ai-dn5:19.7_0: King Mahāvijita is performing a great sacrifice. Let us make an offering as an auxiliary sacrifice.’
ai-dn5:20.1_0: Then the aristocrat vassals of town and country set up gifts to the east of the sacrificial pit.
ai-dn5:20.2_0: The ministers and counselors of town and country set up gifts to the south of the sacrificial pit.
ai-dn5:20.3_0: The well-to-do brahmins and householders of town and country set up gifts to the sacrificial pit.
ai-dn5:20.4_0: The well-off householders of town and country set up gifts to the north of the sacrificial pit.
ai-dn5:20.5_0: And brahmin, in that sacrifice too no cattle were killed, no goats were killed, and no chickens or pigs were killed. There was no slaughter of various kinds of creatures. No trees were felled for the sacrificial post. No grass was reaped to strew over the place of sacrifice.
ai-dn5:20.6_0: No bondservants, employees, or workers did their jobs under threat of punishment and danger, weeping with tearful faces.
ai-dn5:20.7_0: Those who did not want to.
ai-dn5:20.8_0: They did the work they wanted to, and did not do what they didn’t want to.
ai-dn5:20.9_0: The sacrifice was completed with just ghee, oil, butter, curds, honey, and molasses.
ai-dn5:20.10_0: And so there were four consenting factions, eight factors possessed by King Mahāvijita, four factors possessed by the high priest,
ai-dn5:20.12_0: Brahmin, this is called the sacrifice accomplished with three modes and sixteen accessories.”
ai-dn5:21.1_0: When he said this, those brahmins made an uproar,
ai-dn5:21.3_0: But the brahmin Kūṭadanta sat in silence.
ai-dn5:21.4_0: So those brahmins said to him,
ai-dn5:21.5_0: “How can you not applaud the ascetic Gotama’s fine words?”
ai-dn5:21.6_0: “It’s not that I don’t applaud what he said.
ai-dn5:21.7_0: If anyone didn’t applaud such fine words, their head would explode!
ai-dn5:21.8_0: But, gentlemen, it occurs to me that
ai-dn5:21.9_0: The ascetic Gotama doesn’t say this:
ai-dn5:21.10_0: ‘So I have heard’ or ‘It ought to be like this.’
ai-dn5:21.12_0: ‘So it was then, this is how it was then.’
ai-dn5:21.14_0: the ascetic Gotama at that time must have been King Mahāvijita, the owner of the sacrifice, or else the brahmin high priest who facilitated the sacrifice for him.
ai-dn5:21.15_0: Does Master Gotama recall having performed such a sacrifice, or having facilitated it, and then, when his body broke up, after death, being reborn in a good place, a heavenly realm?”
ai-dn5:21.16_0: “I do recall that, brahmin. For at that time I was the brahmin high priest who facilitated the sacrifice.”
ai-dn5:22.1_0: “But Master Gotama, apart from that sacrifice accomplished with three modes and sixteen accessories, is there any other sacrifice that has fewer requirements and undertakings, yet is more fruitful and beneficial?”
ai-dn5:22.4_0: “The regular gifts as ongoing family sacrifice given specially to ethical renunciates;
ai-dn5:22.5_0: this sacrifice, brahmin, has fewer requirements and undertakings, yet is more fruitful and beneficial.”
ai-dn5:23.1_0: “What is the cause, Master Gotama, what is the reason why those regular gifts as ongoing family sacrifice have fewer requirements and undertakings, yet are more fruitful and beneficial, compared with the sacrifice accomplished with three modes and sixteen accessories?”
ai-dn5:23.2_0: “There’s no way to visit that sacrifice.
ai-dn5:23.4_0: Because beatings and throttlings are seen there.
ai-dn5:23.5_0: The regular gifts as ongoing family sacrifice given specially to ethical renunciates;
ai-dn5:23.6_0: perfected ones and those who are on the path to perfection will attend such a sacrifice.
ai-dn5:23.8_0: Because no beatings and throttlings are seen there.
ai-dn5:23.9_0: This is the cause, brahmin, this is the reason why those regular gifts as ongoing family sacrifice have fewer requirements and undertakings, yet are more fruitful and beneficial, compared with the sacrifice accomplished with three modes and sixteen accessories.”
ai-dn5:24.1_0: “But is there any other sacrifice that has fewer requirements and undertakings, yet is more fruitful and beneficial?”
ai-dn5:24.4_0: “Brahmin, the sacrifice that has fewer requirements and undertakings, yet is more fruitful and beneficial.”
ai-dn5:25.1_0: “But is there any other sacrifice that has fewer requirements and undertakings, yet is more fruitful and beneficial?”
ai-dn5:25.4_0: “When someone with confident heart goes for refuge to the Buddha, the teaching, and the Saṅgha.”
ai-dn5:25.5_0: this sacrifice, brahmin, has fewer requirements and undertakings, yet is more fruitful and beneficial.”
ai-dn5:26.1_0: “But is there any other sacrifice that has fewer requirements and undertakings, yet is more fruitful and beneficial?”
ai-dn5:26.4_0: “When someone with a confident heart undertakes the training rules
ai-dn5:26.5_0: to refrain from killing living creatures, stealing, sexual misconduct, lying, and alcoholic drinks that cause negligence.”
ai-dn5:26.6_0: this sacrifice, brahmin, has fewer requirements and undertakings, yet is more fruitful and beneficial.”
ai-dn5:27.1_0: “But is there any other sacrifice that has fewer requirements and undertakings, yet is more fruitful and beneficial?”
ai-dn5:27.4_0: “It’s when a Realized One arises in the world, perfected, a fully awakened Buddha ...
ai-dn5:27.5_0: That’s how a mendicant is accomplished in ethics. ...
ai-dn5:27.6_0: dwells having attained the first absorption,
ai-dn5:27.7_0: This sacrifice has fewer requirements and undertakings than the former, yet is more fruitful and beneficial. ...
ai-dn5:27.10_0: dwells having attained the fourth absorption.
ai-dn5:27.11_0: This sacrifice has fewer requirements and undertakings than the former, yet is more fruitful and beneficial.
ai-dn5:27.12_0: They extend and project the mind toward knowledge and vision ...
ai-dn5:27.13_0: This sacrifice has fewer requirements and undertakings than the former, yet is more fruitful and beneficial.
ai-dn5:27.14_0: They understand: ‘... there is no return to any state of existence.’
ai-dn5:27.15_0: This sacrifice has fewer requirements and undertakings than the former, yet is more fruitful and beneficial.
ai-dn5:27.16_0: And, brahmin, there is no other sacrifice that is better or finer than this.”
ai-dn5:28.1_0: When he had spoken, Kūṭadanta said to the Buddha,
ai-dn5:28.3_0: Just as one might set upright what had been overturned, or reveal what had been hidden, or show the way to one who was lost, or bring a lamp into the darkness so that
ai-dn5:28.3_1: so that one with eyes might see what’s there—
ai-dn5:28.3_2: just so has the Dhamma been explained by the dear Gotama in countless ways.
ai-dn5:28.4_0: Good Gotama, I go for refuge to you, and to the Teaching and to the Sangha of monks.
ai-dn5:28.5_0: From this day forth, may Master Gotama remember me as a lay follower who has gone for refuge for life.
ai-dn5:28.6_0: And these bulls, bullocks, heifers, goats, and rams—seven hundred of each—I release them, I grant them life! Let them eat green grass and drink cool water, and may a cool breeze blow upon them!”
ai-dn5:29.1_0: Then the Buddha taught Kūṭadanta step by step, with
ai-dn5:29.2_0: a talk on giving, ethical conduct, and heaven.
ai-dn5:29.3_0: He explained the drawbacks of sensual pleasures, so so sordid and corrupt, and the benefit of renunciation.
ai-dn5:29.4_0: And when he knew that Kūṭadanta’s mind was ready, pliable, rid of hindrances, joyful, and confident he explained the special teaching of the Buddhas:
ai-dn5:29.5_0: suffering, its origin, its cessation, and the path.
ai-dn5:29.6_0: Just as a clean cloth rid of stains would properly absorb dye,
ai-dn5:29.7_0: in that very seat the stainless, immaculate vision of the Dhamma arose in the brahmin Kūṭadanta:
ai-dn5:29.8_0: “Anything that has a beginning has an end.”
ai-dn5:30.1_0: Then Kūṭadanta saw, attained, understood, and fathomed the Dhamma. He went beyond doubt, got rid of indecision, and became self-assured and independent of others regarding the Teacher’s instructions. He said to the Buddha,
ai-dn5:30.2_0: “Good Gotama, please accept tomorrow’s meal from me together with the Sangha of monks.”
ai-dn5:30.3_0: The Buddha consented by remaining silent.
ai-dn5:30.4_0: Then, knowing that the Buddha had consented, Kūṭadanta got up from his seat, bowed, and respectfully circled the Buddha, keeping him on his right, before leaving.
ai-dn5:30.5_0: And when the night had passed Kūṭadanta had a variety of delicious foods prepared in his own home. Then he had the Buddha informed of the time, saying,
ai-dn5:30.6_0: saying: “It is time, dear Gotama, the meal is ready.”
ai-dn5:30.7_0: Then the Buddha robed up in the morning and, taking his bowl and robe, went to the home of Kūṭadanta together with the mendicant Saṅgha.
ai-dn5:30.7_1: and after going, he sat down on the prepared seat.
ai-dn5:30.8_0: Then Kūṭadanta served and satisfied the mendicant Saṅgha headed by the Buddha with his own hands with a variety of delicious foods.
ai-dn5:30.9_0: When the Buddha had eaten and washed his hand and bowl, Kūṭadanta took a low seat and sat to one side.
ai-dn5:30.10_0: Then the Buddha educated, encouraged, fired up, and inspired him with a Dhamma talk, after which he got up from his seat and left.
ai-dn5:30.11_0: The fifth section on Kūṭadanta is finished.
